availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Hubert A. McCaleb (LaSalle County, Illinois, soldier)

body.p: LaSalle County, Illinois, soldier. Putnam County, Illinois native. Attended school in LaSalle County in 1850. Served in the 11th Illinois Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as sergeant, second lieutenant, and first lieutenant from October 31, 1861. Served in the 6th United States Colored Heavy Artillery Regiment as lieutenant colonel and colonel from November 8, 1863 to May 13, 1866. Served with the 121st United States Colored Infantry Regiment as colonel from March 10, 1865 to June 30, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Illinois, LaSalle County, Hope, p. 224B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Illinois, LaSalle County, Hope, p. 56.
Illinois State Marriage Records, Online index, Illinois State Public Record Offices (accessed through ancestry.com on December 14, 2018).
Illinois Civil War Muster and Descriptive Rolls Detail Report, Illinois State Archives, https://www.ilsos.gov/isaveterans/civilMusterSearch.do?key=163292 (accessed December 14, 2018).
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served the United States Colored Troops: 56th-138th USCT Infantry, 1864-1866, NARA Roll RG94-USCT-121-Bx06.
